subject: p10933609
History: Patient with recurrent aspiration pneumonia, interval change.
Findings: There is increase in moderate left loculated pleural effusion. The left lung opacification has also increased, concerning for worsening infection. Right upper lobe scarring is unchanged. There is no pneumothorax. The mediastinal and cardiac contours are normal. By reviewing the initial chest x-ray of, there was scarring in bilateral upper lobes which could either reflect scarring from previous aspiration, but sarcoid could also be a possibility.
Impression: Increase in moderate left loculated pleural effusion. Worsening of left lung pneumonia. Wet read was done by Dr. At 6:14 pm, .
